intro: Pouzolzia quinquenervis, commonly known as the five-veined pouzolzia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite, with five distinct veins running from the base to the tip. Pouzolzia quinquenervis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
